title: VRExpress
author: VRExpress
content: What's the best I can buy for RTX 3070 ti and 3080s that can suppress heat been discharged when gaming and mining, the GPUs gets less heat when I open the cover of the case I have presently but I don't want to keep the case opened because of dust in my area.

comments.author: xxcsu
comments.body: Install water block on the gpus , convert your system to liquid cooled setup

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Quote from: VRExpress on August 27, 2022, 10:50:30 AMWhat's the best I can buy for RTX 3070 ti and 3080s that can suppress heat been discharged when gaming and mining, the GPUs gets less heat when I open the cover of the case I have presently but I don't want to keep the case opened because of dust in my area. Look at reviews of Cold Case on 8-12 Video Cards. This case has airflow separation and removable dust filters. According to reviews, a very good case, but from the minuses, it takes a very long time to assemble it. Or look at analogues in your country.

comments.author: adaseb
comments.body: Having a closed case can be tricky.A regular gamer PC case will have heating and ventilation issues with only 2 GPUs. Usually one GPU will be fine but depending on how close it is to the other GPU on the motherboard, that one will have heat issues due to lack of ventilation space.If you really want to have 2, you can use a large PC gamer case but you should seperate them as far as you can on the motherboard and then with good intake and exhaust fans you will be fine. If you want more than 2, then you need a server chassis case which is good for up to 8 GPUs but its crazy loud.

comments.author: JayDDee
comments.body: If dust is the issue you'll need lots of fans and filters. You can't "suppress" the heat but you can channel it away from its source.Maybe a computer/mining case isn't the solution, maybe just a well ventilated and filtered enclosure of some kind like a tent.

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: I clean my video cards from dust a maximum of several times a year. Maybe I got bold?It is probably better to buy a housing with a filter and clean or wash this filter at a longer interval.Or don't buy hot video cards. All the same, I'm more inclined towards the option of a closed case with a filter, if the video cards have already been purchased.
